alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Maine, including the following counties, in southwest Maine, Cumberland. In western Maine, Oxford. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Bethel, Waterford, Brownfield, Denmark, Lovell, Greenwood and Sweden.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
